title: Telford
summary: Telford (/ˈtɛlfərd/ (listen)) is a large town in the borough of Telford and Wrekin and ceremonial county of Shropshire, England, about 15 miles (24 km) east of Shrewsbury, 21 miles (34 km) south west of Stafford, 19 miles (31 km) north west of Wolverhampton, and 28 miles (45 km) from Birmingham in the same direction. With an estimated population (for the borough) of 175,271 in 2017[2] and around 155,000 in Telford itself,[3] Telford is the largest town in Shropshire, and one of the fastest-growing towns in the United Kingdom.[4]
